sub_title: Creative mind with a passion for cultural and social puzzles | Coach for Personal Development | Project Facilitator
summary:
Hi and nice to meet you!

My name is Denise and I am a coach for personal development as well as a project facilitator specialized in sustainability, cultural and social domains.

I have a diverse professional background having worked on environmental, cultural and social issues across four continents. This diversity reflects my innate curiosity to explore the world, my creative problem-solving skills, and my genuine interest in people.

These qualities are especially valuable in my work as a coach and project facilitator. As a coach, I work with individuals on their personal and professional journey. As a facilitator, I accompany projects from inception to implementation, provide strategic advice, and intervene during critical moments.

I started my own business in March 2023 after having worked for various state and non-state organizations, giving myself the full freedom to work on what matters most to me, to be flexible, as well as apply and continuously learn different skills as an entrepreneur.

PAST EXPERIENCE
I worked for the Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs on water management, where I got trained in diplomacy and international cooperation. I worked for the Mekong River Commission in Laos with people from Laos, Cambodia, Thailand and Vietnam. I was part of the NGO Asia Society Switzerland working on Asian geopolitics, cultural and social affairs. I worked in Costa Rica with a local organization in Central America, focusing on women's empowerment.

profile_positions.description:
I provide 1:1 coaching in English and (Swiss-)German, both online and in person. Check out my website for more information at denisestaubli.com/coaching or book a free new client info call at calendly.com/denisestaubli/coaching-info-call

My aim as a coach for personal development is to to empower people so that they can be in their strengths and live a fulfilling life at ease with themselves. I firmly believe that people are valuable as they are and carry everything in themselves to live the life they want. The answer to a problem or what to do next is, however, not always obvious. We might be stuck in emotions, complicated circumstances or our own patterns and beliefs. I support my clients by giving them a safe space to share what needs to be shared, to let go what no longer needs to be there, and to discover their own paths – be it in their personal or professional life.
profile_positions.title: Coach for Personal Development

profile_positions.description:
Need a hand? A second pair of ears and eyes? A creativity-extension? I am here to provide tailored support for a short or long period of time, implementing assignments in different fields, such as international cooperation, sustainability, social and cultural domains. I offer temporary support, covering for absent staff or parental leaves. Possible contributions:
- Concept Development
- Report Writing & Editing
- Junior Professional Mentoring
- Problem Solving
- Consultancy & Coaching
- Project Management

Check out my website for more information at denisestaubli.com/consultancy
profile_positions.title: Project Facilitator

profile_positions.description:
I successfully launched and produced the Asia Society Switzerland podcast, starting with a season on China and the World, followed by another season on Meet My Country where local people speak about their country. I also developed the concept and content for several online event series and formats on Asia (geo)politics, cultural and social issues. In parallel, I developed and maintained an event and project data tracking and analysis system for stats on our work and generating data-based insights.

Asia Society Switzerland is a NGO dedicated to Asia. Its mission is to foster Asia Competence and prepare Switzerland for a deeper and more sustainable engagement with Asia.
profile_positions.title: Program Officer

profile_positions.description:
The Mekong River Commission (MRC) is an inter-governmental river basin organization established by the riparian countries of Laos, Thailand, Viet Nam, and Cambodia. 

During my tenure at MRC, I played a multifaceted role that included supporting partnership development with other regional organizations and engaging in communication efforts. One notable project involved summarizing findings from a multi-annual study on the Mekong and the potential impacts of mainstream dams. This information was curated for an interactive website designed to showcase the study's results. Additionally, I actively contributed to MRC's organizational reform initiatives, sharing insights on MRC workflows and supporting the decentralization of river-monitoring activities. My responsibilities extended to internal Monitoring and Evaluation, where I drafted sections for donor reports. I also prepared inputs, including briefings, for high-level MRC meetings attended by ministers and other government officials from MRC member countries.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

company.name: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation

profile_positions.company: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation
profile_positions.description:
The Mekong River Commission (MRC) is an inter-governmental river basin organization established by the riparian countries of Laos, Thailand, Viet Nam, and Cambodia. The Swiss government has been a financial supporter of this organization. I had the privilege of being the first Swiss professional to be seconded to the MRC working with people from the four member countries. 

I was mainly responsible for coordinating the decentralisation of river monitoring activities and conducting an internal review report. I supported the development of partnerships e.g. with ASEAN, ADB/GMS, Lancang-Mekong Cooperation. I was involved in the content preparation and coordination work for the MRC International Conference 2018 in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Other work included organisational reform initiatives, including the set-up of MRC Expert Groups; M&E work; inputs for MRC high-level meetings.
profile_positions.title: Seconded to the Mekong River Commission by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation

profile_positions.company: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation
profile_positions.description: I was part of the 2016 cohort of the Swiss Department of Foreign Affairs, where I received specialized training in diplomacy and international cooperation. Within this program, I was assigned to work with the SDC Global Program Water, where I took on a role that involved managing international projects focused on transboundary water resource management, water governance, and the implementation of SDG 6, which pertains to clean water and sanitation. My responsibilities, among others, included conducting field missions to Mozambique and Tanzania. Additionally, I had the opportunity to further enhance my expertise by receiving training in water management from a dedicated expert in Senegal.
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer

profile_positions.description: I had the privilege of collaborating with Markus Lehni, an early Swiss pioneer in corporate sustainability, during my time at Novartis. My role involved providing support in the development and implementation of environmental tools as part of the Novartis Group environmental program. Additionally, I made contributions to communication efforts, including the updating of the internal intranet with a focus on sustainability projects within Novartis
profile_positions.title: Scientific Assistant to the Novartis Group Global Head Environment and Energy

company.name: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH

profile_positions.company: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
profile_positions.description: For my master's thesis on newly introduced water licensing systems, I collaborated with the German development agency GIZ in Zambia and Kenya. Within this role, I undertook the planning and execution of a scientific project focused on the allocation of water use permits and integrity challenges in both Kenya and Zambia. Subsequently, I conducted a thorough analysis of the legal provisions in these countries, followed by a series of interviews with water management authorities, key water users/associations, and experts in both nations.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.company: seecon gmbh Innovations for Sustainable Development
profile_positions.description:
During one semester of my studies in sustainable development, I worked full-time for seecon, a Swiss consultancy company specializing in the development, support, and management of innovative sustainable development projects worldwide. 

I collaborated on a project in the field of sustainable sanitation, where I reviewed and authored content for https://sswm.info/ - a comprehensive toolbox for sustainable sanitation and water management. Additionally, I made significant contributions to the creation of a toolkit aimed at water utilities and other stakeholders in the water sector, addressing issues related to water management, integrity, and the prevention of corruption.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
During my extended summer break at university, I joined BIOAZUL in Malaga, Spain, an engineering and technology consulting company specializing in the development of eco-innovative and sustainable solutions for the treatment and reuse of water resources. 

I contributed to an international Research & Development project funded by the EU, known as TREAT&USE, which focused on wastewater reuse in European agriculture. My responsibilities included conducting an analysis of the legal requirements and determining selection criteria for the countries in which to test the new technology under development.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: I gained insights into a challenging period in Switzerland's history when asbestos was still in use, causing significant health issues for many individuals. I meticulously reviewed hundreds of patients' documents, delving into their personal experiences with asbestos exposure and their medical histories. My role involved capturing and organizing all pertinent information, contributing to the establishment of Switzerland's first asbestos databank.
profile_positions.title: Assistant at the Department of Chemistry

profile_positions.description:
Voces Nuestras is a local organization in Costa Rica dedicated to fostering creative and innovative community communication processes among women, youth, and indigenous communities. Their mission revolves around supporting the defense of disputed territories in Mesoamerica, encompassing body, air, land, and historical memory rights. This is achieved through the exercise of the Human Right to Communication, political training, and the pedagogy of historical memory, all viewed through a feminist lens.

During my tenure, I was assisting in conducting workshops for women in cooperatives across Nicaragua and Costa Rica. Additionally, I played an integral role in the 'Concurso 2013 Mujeres, Economía Solidaria y Consumo Responsable' project, which aimed to empower women in cooperatives across Central America, allowing them to share their stories in a book and radio novellas. Furthermore, I conducted interviews in Spanish as part of a study focused on the utilization of communication tools by local broadcasting and news sharing platforms.
profile_positions.title: Intern
